<item><title>Brazil's Temer calls for unity, confidence for Brazil recovery</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/brazils-temer-calls-unity-confidence-brazil-recovery-012620114--business.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/V7y4FPj6Am8y4xD0ekI3kA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T052309Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C06O_RTROPTP_2_BRAZIL-POLITICS.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Brazil&#039;s interim President Michel Temer smiles during a ceremony where he made his first public remarks after the Brazilian Senate voted to impeach President Dilma Rousseff at the Planalto Palace in Brasilia" align="left" title="Brazil&#039;s interim President Michel Temer smiles during a ceremony where he made his first public remarks after the Brazilian Senate voted to impeach President Dilma Rousseff at the Planalto Palace in Brasilia" border="0" /></a>By Lisandra Paraguassu and Alonso Soto BRASILIA (Reuters) - Brazil&#039;s interim President Michel Temer called on his country to rally behind his government of &quot;national salvation,&quot; hours after the Senate voted to suspend and put on trial his leftist predecessor, Dilma Rousseff, for breaking budget laws. Temer, a 75-year-old centrist now moving to steer Latin America&#039;s biggest country toward more market-friendly policies, told Brazilians to have &quot;confidence&quot; they would overcome an ongoing crisis sparked by a deep economic recession, political volatility and a sprawling corruption scandal. &quot;It is urgent we calm the nation and unite Brazil,&quot; he said, after a signing ceremony for his incoming cabinet.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/brazils-temer-calls-unity-confidence-brazil-recovery-012620114--business.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 21:26:20 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">brazils-temer-calls-unity-confidence-brazil-recovery-012620114--business</guid><media:content url="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/V7y4FPj6Am8y4xD0ekI3kA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T052309Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C06O_RTROPTP_2_BRAZIL-POLITICS.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/brazils-temer-calls-unity-confidence-brazil-recovery-012620114--business.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/V7y4FPj6Am8y4xD0ekI3kA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T052309Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C06O_RTROPTP_2_BRAZIL-POLITICS.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Brazil&#039;s interim President Michel Temer smiles during a ceremony where he made his first public remarks after the Brazilian Senate voted to impeach President Dilma Rousseff at the Planalto Palace in Brasilia" align="left" title="Brazil&#039;s interim President Michel Temer smiles during a ceremony where he made his first public remarks after the Brazilian Senate voted to impeach President Dilma Rousseff at the Planalto Palace in Brasilia" border="0" /></a>By Lisandra Paraguassu and Alonso Soto BRASILIA (Reuters) - Brazil&#039;s interim President Michel Temer called on his country to rally behind his government of &quot;national salvation,&quot; hours after the Senate voted to suspend and put on trial his leftist predecessor, Dilma Rousseff, for breaking budget laws. Temer, a 75-year-old centrist now moving to steer Latin America&#039;s biggest country toward more market-friendly policies, told Brazilians to have &quot;confidence&quot; they would overcome an ongoing crisis sparked by a deep economic recession, political volatility and a sprawling corruption scandal. &quot;It is urgent we calm the nation and unite Brazil,&quot; he said, after a signing ceremony for his incoming cabinet.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Top Hezbollah commander killed in Syria</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/lebanons-hezbollah-says-top-commander-killed-israeli-air-022259134.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/e06Ph4xVa1Dbm1u.xd2rgw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T051811Z_1007000001_LYNXNPEC4C068_RTROPTP_2_CNEWS-US-MIDEAST-CRISIS-HEZBOLLAH.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Top Hezbollah commander Mustafa Badreddine is seen in this handout picture released by Hezbollah Media office" align="left" title="Top Hezbollah commander Mustafa Badreddine is seen in this handout picture released by Hezbollah Media office" border="0" /></a>Top Hezbollah commander Mustafa Badreddine has been killed in an attack in Syria, the Lebanese group said on Friday, the biggest blow to the Iranian-backed organization since its military chief was killed in 2008. Badreddine, 55, was one of the highest ranking officials in the group, and assessed by the U.S. government to be responsible for Hezbollah&#039;s military operations in Syria, where it is fighting alongside the Syrian President Bashar al-Assad. Hezbollah said Badreddine had been killed in a big explosion targeting one of its bases near Damascus airport, and an investigation was underway into whether it was caused by an air strike, a missile attack, or artillery bombardment.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/lebanons-hezbollah-says-top-commander-killed-israeli-air-022259134.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:56:29 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">lebanons-hezbollah-says-top-commander-killed-israeli-air-022259134</guid><media:content url="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/e06Ph4xVa1Dbm1u.xd2rgw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T051811Z_1007000001_LYNXNPEC4C068_RTROPTP_2_CNEWS-US-MIDEAST-CRISIS-HEZBOLLAH.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/lebanons-hezbollah-says-top-commander-killed-israeli-air-022259134.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/e06Ph4xVa1Dbm1u.xd2rgw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T051811Z_1007000001_LYNXNPEC4C068_RTROPTP_2_CNEWS-US-MIDEAST-CRISIS-HEZBOLLAH.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Top Hezbollah commander Mustafa Badreddine is seen in this handout picture released by Hezbollah Media office" align="left" title="Top Hezbollah commander Mustafa Badreddine is seen in this handout picture released by Hezbollah Media office" border="0" /></a>Top Hezbollah commander Mustafa Badreddine has been killed in an attack in Syria, the Lebanese group said on Friday, the biggest blow to the Iranian-backed organization since its military chief was killed in 2008. Badreddine, 55, was one of the highest ranking officials in the group, and assessed by the U.S. government to be responsible for Hezbollah&#039;s military operations in Syria, where it is fighting alongside the Syrian President Bashar al-Assad. Hezbollah said Badreddine had been killed in a big explosion targeting one of its bases near Damascus airport, and an investigation was underway into whether it was caused by an air strike, a missile attack, or artillery bombardment.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Shooting in northern Iraqi town kills 12 - police, hospital sources</title><description>Three gunmen opened fire overnight on a cafe in northern Iraq where young men had gathered at the start of the weekend holiday, killing at least 12 and wounding 25, police and hospital sources said on Friday. The assailants in the mainly Shi'ite town of Balad, 80 km (50 miles) north of Baghdad, sprayed machine gun fire from their cars for around 10 minutes before speeding off. The area, which was nearly overrun by Islamic State militants in 2014 and remains around 40 km from a frontline held by Shi'ite militiamen, is heavily secured.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/shooting-northern-iraqi-town-kills-12-police-hospital-055932026.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:19:38 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">shooting-northern-iraqi-town-kills-12-police-hospital-055932026</guid></item><item><title>China, U.S. should manage South China Sea differences constructively: Chinese general</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/china-u-manage-south-china-sea-differences-constructively-020013542.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/lADpZE7N47x6zKFxhR0oPA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T020013Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C02B_RTROPTP_2_VIETNAM-CHINA-SPRATLY.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="A patrol bock is seen on Da Tay island in the Spratly archipelago" align="left" title="A patrol bock is seen on Da Tay island in the Spratly archipelago" border="0" /></a>China and the United States should manage their differences over disputed waters in the South China Sea constructively, one of China&#039;s top military officials has said. Fang Fenghui, a member of China&#039;s Central Military Commission, told General Joseph Dunford, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, the two sides should &quot;refrain from actions detrimental to the relations between the two countries and the two militaries&quot;, state news agency Xinhua reported on Friday. Fang and Dunford discussed the South China Sea in a video link-up on Thursday, it said.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/china-u-manage-south-china-sea-differences-constructively-020013542.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:13:37 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">china-u-manage-south-china-sea-differences-constructively-020013542</guid><media:content url="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/lADpZE7N47x6zKFxhR0oPA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T020013Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C02B_RTROPTP_2_VIETNAM-CHINA-SPRATLY.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/china-u-manage-south-china-sea-differences-constructively-020013542.html"><img src="http://l.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/lADpZE7N47x6zKFxhR0oPA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T020013Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C02B_RTROPTP_2_VIETNAM-CHINA-SPRATLY.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="A patrol bock is seen on Da Tay island in the Spratly archipelago" align="left" title="A patrol bock is seen on Da Tay island in the Spratly archipelago" border="0" /></a>China and the United States should manage their differences over disputed waters in the South China Sea constructively, one of China&#039;s top military officials has said. Fang Fenghui, a member of China&#039;s Central Military Commission, told General Joseph Dunford, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, the two sides should &quot;refrain from actions detrimental to the relations between the two countries and the two militaries&quot;, state news agency Xinhua reported on Friday. Fang and Dunford discussed the South China Sea in a video link-up on Thursday, it said.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Turkish military says eight soldiers, six PKK militants killed in southeast</title><description>Eight Turkish soldiers and six members of the outlawed Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) were killed on Friday, the Turkish military said, in the latest violence related to the insurgency in the largely Kurdish southeast. Six soldiers were killed and eight were wounded in clashes with PKK militants in the southeastern Hakkari province, the military said in a statement. Two more soldiers were killed in a separate incident in Hakkari when a military helicopter crashed due to technical fault, it said, adding that six PKK militants were killed in the operation in the region.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/turkish-military-says-eight-soldiers-six-pkk-militants-061245026.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:12:45 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">turkish-military-says-eight-soldiers-six-pkk-militants-061245026</guid></item><item><title>War on Islamist militants tests Tunisia's young democracy</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/war-islamist-militants-tests-tunisias-young-democracy-061715283.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/VCzKWZ_Qtz7T1QfF51oYqg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T061715Z_1007000001_LYNXNPEC4C088_RTROPTP_2_CNEWS-US-TUNISIA-DEMOCRACY-INSIGHT.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Sofiane Melliti, 38, a Tunisian soccer player who says he has been harassed by authorities because of suspected ties to militant attacks, poses for a photograph in Tunis" align="left" title="Sofiane Melliti, 38, a Tunisian soccer player who says he has been harassed by authorities because of suspected ties to militant attacks, poses for a photograph in Tunis" border="0" /></a>Four days after Islamist militants shot dead 21 tourists in Tunisia&#039;s Bardo museum last year, police rounded up dozens of people suspected of links with the gunmen.    One of the men, a laborer, was arrested in his Tunis home. &quot;I thought I didn&#039;t have any other way out.&quot;    Several recent cases of police abuse – which the Tunisian government acknowledges still sometimes occurs – underscore the difficult path Tunisia is treading as it tries to both nurture the young democracy it founded after the 2011 revolution and simultaneously fight Islamist militants.     Like France, Belgium and other victims of Islamist bombings and attacks, Tunisia is trying to figure out how to protect people while also protecting their rights.      That process is even more difficult in a country where the security services themselves are trying to emerge from a history as abusers.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/war-islamist-militants-tests-tunisias-young-democracy-061715283.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:17:15 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/VCzKWZ_Qtz7T1QfF51oYqg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T061715Z_1007000001_LYNXNPEC4C088_RTROPTP_2_CNEWS-US-TUNISIA-DEMOCRACY-INSIGHT.JPG" company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Rural midwives on front line of Sierra Leone maternity crisis</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/rural-midwives-front-line-sierra-leone-maternity-crisis-061819098.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/VLmNW_qVhiKYPDN9OIFGHQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/2486965a9cc5f3d34ed7d6d34043eba54e76de04.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Students at the Masuba Midwifery School in Sierra Leone practice cardiopulmonary resuscitation on a dummy" align="left" title="Students at the Masuba Midwifery School in Sierra Leone practice cardiopulmonary resuscitation on a dummy" border="0" /></a>It is final exams season at Masuba midwifery school in rural Sierra Leone, and 70 more students are about to begin working life at the sharp end of the country&#039;s maternal health crisis. Established in 2010, the school is only the second dedicated midwife training unit for a country of seven million people, located at the end of a bone-shaking series of dirt tracks several hours from the capital by car. &quot;My first placement where I was sent in Kabala (a northern town)... people don&#039;t believe in the hospital facility,&quot; said Aminata Kanu, sitting in her classroom with dozens of others in identical blue uniforms and white hats.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/rural-midwives-front-line-sierra-leone-maternity-crisis-061819098.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:18:19 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">rural-midwives-front-line-sierra-leone-maternity-crisis-061819098</guid><media:content url="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/VLmNW_qVhiKYPDN9OIFGHQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/2486965a9cc5f3d34ed7d6d34043eba54e76de04.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/rural-midwives-front-line-sierra-leone-maternity-crisis-061819098.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/VLmNW_qVhiKYPDN9OIFGHQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/2486965a9cc5f3d34ed7d6d34043eba54e76de04.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Students at the Masuba Midwifery School in Sierra Leone practice cardiopulmonary resuscitation on a dummy" align="left" title="Students at the Masuba Midwifery School in Sierra Leone practice cardiopulmonary resuscitation on a dummy" border="0" /></a>It is final exams season at Masuba midwifery school in rural Sierra Leone, and 70 more students are about to begin working life at the sharp end of the country&#039;s maternal health crisis. Established in 2010, the school is only the second dedicated midwife training unit for a country of seven million people, located at the end of a bone-shaking series of dirt tracks several hours from the capital by car. &quot;My first placement where I was sent in Kabala (a northern town)... people don&#039;t believe in the hospital facility,&quot; said Aminata Kanu, sitting in her classroom with dozens of others in identical blue uniforms and white hats.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Long road to recovery for the victims of Iraq bombings</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/long-road-recovery-victims-iraq-061747592.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/dq_ySq6mDI4y8RyDEsiYDg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/ap_webfeeds/f7d0eac504b9464d80bc500b1e7f2860.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="In this Wednesday, May 4, 2016 photo, national flags, flowers and balls surround the poster of Muhannad Khazaal, 6, at the soccer field where he died in the March bombing of a football game in in Iskandariyah, 25 miles (about 40 kilometers) south of Baghdad, Iraq. url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">german-economy-accelerates-grows-0-061714809</guid></item><item><title>Ghosn upbeat $2.2 billion deal for Mitsubishi a One key nomination was a respected former central bank chief, Henrique Meirelles, for finance minister, with the task of helping the huge economy claw out of the deepest recession in decades.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Challenge to Australia's Senate voting reforms in boost for PM Turnbull</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/challenge-australias-senate-voting-reforms-rejected-boost-pm-011200316.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/kt8SO3ig9Aoq3qEUN97iIQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T011200Z_1007000001_LYNXNPEC4C01P_RTROPTP_2_CNEWS-US-AUSTRALIA-POLITICS.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull stands outside Australia&#039;s Parliament House in Canberra May 4, 2016 following the announcement Australia&#039;s 2016-17 Federal Budget" align="left" title="Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull stands outside Australia&#039;s Parliament House in Canberra May 4, 2016 following the announcement Australia&#039;s 2016-17 Federal Budget" border="0" /></a>By Colin Packham SYDNEY (Reuters) - Australia&#039;s High Court rejected a challenge to reforms to Senate voting on Friday in a boost for Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull ahead of elections on July 2. He was barred by the Dominican Republic's constitution from running for s second straight term.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/dominican-republic-president-seems-destined-election-040113866.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:01:13 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">dominican-republic-president-seems-destined-election-040113866</guid></item><item><title>Turkey visa deal unravels as Erdogan defies EU on key condition</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/erdogan-refuses-bow-key-condition-visas-101135321.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/c1F1Pttxy4LO0yA7cD05ag--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/f38846caacdbaa2c6422f9ad5df507a2b4a6585f.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoga has accused the EU of hypocrisy" align="left" title="Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoga has accused the EU of hypocrisy" border="0" /></a>A deal to grant Turks visa-free travel to most of the European Union was hanging by a thread after President Recep Tayyip Erdogan defiantly vowed Ankara would not fulfil a key condition set by Brussels. With alarm growing over the deal&#039;s future, European Commission chief Jean-Claude Juncker bluntly told Erdogan that Turks would only enjoy travel to the passport-free Schengen area if all conditions were met and it would be &quot;his problem&quot; if this failed to materialise. The promise of visa-free travel is a key pillar of the landmark March accord for Turkey to stem the flow of migrants to the EU and this could now also be in peril.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/erdogan-refuses-bow-key-condition-visas-101135321.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:56:31 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">erdogan-refuses-bow-key-condition-visas-101135321</guid><media:content url="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/c1F1Pttxy4LO0yA7cD05ag--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/f38846caacdbaa2c6422f9ad5df507a2b4a6585f.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/erdogan-refuses-bow-key-condition-visas-101135321.html"><img src="http://l3.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/c1F1Pttxy4LO0yA7cD05ag--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/f38846caacdbaa2c6422f9ad5df507a2b4a6585f.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoga has accused the EU of hypocrisy" align="left" title="Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoga has accused the EU of hypocrisy" border="0" /></a>A deal to grant Turks visa-free travel to most of the European Union was hanging by a thread after President Recep Tayyip Erdogan defiantly vowed Ankara would not fulfil a key condition set by Brussels. With alarm growing over the deal&#039;s future, European Commission chief Jean-Claude Juncker bluntly told Erdogan that Turks would only enjoy travel to the passport-free Schengen area if all conditions were met and it would be &quot;his problem&quot; if this failed to materialise. The promise of visa-free travel is a key pillar of the landmark March accord for Turkey to stem the flow of migrants to the EU and this could now also be in peril.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Top Asian News 3:56 a.m. GMT</title><description>SYDNEY (AP) — An Australian couple whose three children were killed in the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 over Ukraine two years ago have welcomed a new baby, saying the birth has given them faith that love trumps hate. Anthony Maslin and Marite Norris, of the western Australian city of Perth, said the arrival of their daughter Violet May Maslin on Tuesday had brought them "love and light, hope and joy" after enduring two years of grief over the loss of their three children. Mo, 12, Evie, 10, and Otis, 8, died along with their grandfather, Nick Norris, when Flight 17 was shot down by a missile over eastern Ukraine in July 2014.</description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/top-asian-news-4-17-m-gmt-041724748.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:56:06 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">top-asian-news-4-17-m-gmt-041724748</guid></item><item><title>US ready to loosen Libya arms embargo: US official</title><description><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/us-ready-loosen-libya-arms-embargo-us-official-030301974.html"><img src="http://l1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Z9GHpYemjnJXOZuaX46pKw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/04ae79b0bfd1455554dcf6bf2300a242dc4bfca4.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Libyans demonstrate in Benghazi calling for military forces to re-capture the southern city of Sirte from the Islamic State group without foreign intervention" align="left" title="Libyans demonstrate in Benghazi calling for military forces to re-capture the southern city of Sirte from the Islamic State group without foreign intervention" border="0" /></a>The US government is ready to loosen a ban on arms exports to Libya, in a bid to help the country&#039;s fledgling unity government fight the Islamic State group, officials and diplomats told AFP. later this month labelled a &#039;lame duck&#039; leader after his rapprochement with China turned the public against him" border="0" /></a>He won Taiwan&#039;s largest ever landslide victory, a safe pair of hands promising prosperity and stability -- but president Ma Ying-jeou leaves office this month caricatured as incompetent, aloof and wildly out of step with public sentiment. Coolly coiffed with a sweep of jet-black hair, urbane Ma was seen as a reliable &quot;Mr Clean&quot; when he stormed to victory for the Kuomintang party in 2008, replacing an outgoing opposition government mired in corruption. Relations with Beijing had sunk to a low under Ma&#039;s predecessor President Chen Shui-bian of the Democratic Progressive Party.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>http://news.yahoo.com/fallen-hero-tide-turned-taiwans-ma-024848393.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:48:48 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">fallen-hero-tide-turned-taiwans-ma-024848393</guid><media:content url="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/NxRhjYCAVDu6UF.8rDtfJQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/71c219f6f77a8ad429063e6c276e975640c30363.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="http://news.yahoo.com/fallen-hero-tide-turned-taiwans-ma-024848393.html"><img src="http://l2.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/NxRhjYCAVDu6UF.8rDtfJQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/71c219f6f77a8ad429063e6c276e975640c30363.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="He won Taiwan&#039;s largest ever landslide victory to become president in 2008, but Ma Ying-jeou leaves office later this month labelled a &#039;lame duck&#039; leader after his rapprochement with China turned the public against him" align="left" title="He won Taiwan&#039;s largest ever landslide victory to become president in 2008, but Ma Ying-jeou leaves office later this month labelled a &#039;lame duck&#039; leader after his rapprochement with China turned the public against him" border="0" /></a>He won Taiwan&#039;s largest ever landslide victory, a safe pair of hands promising prosperity and stability -- but president Ma Ying-jeou leaves office this month caricatured as incompetent, aloof and wildly out of step with public sentiment.
